reviews.content: Tasted again after long time - one point higher than last time
reviews.nose: Honey, yellow fruits, apple, peach, plums, quince, spices, pepper, cloves, nuts, little citric, lemon peel, hint of oak wood
reviews.taste: Oily, nutty, cooked fruits, apple, plum, figs, woody, tobacco, dark honey, subtle sweetness, spices, some herbs
reviews.finish: Medium long, warm, nutty, tobacco, spices, woody, hint of leather

reviews.content: Fruity and little citric - nice and drinkable
This is for one of the earlier 14 year bottlings.
Too bitter for me, this is an old bottling, one of the first of the 14 year but the classic Oban profile is there.
reviews.nose: Light and floral with citrus notes and a little honey.
reviews.taste: A little bitter on coffee notes mixed in with bitter orange and a little honey.There is a little sweetness coming through but its not enough to compensate as there is also a little saltiness.
reviews.finish: Long finish and quite smooth with the sweet notes finally overcoming the bitterness on the palate.

reviews.content: Representing the West Highlands in Diageo's Classic Malts of Scotland, Oban 14 features a mineral and slightly salty character. The aroma is both engaging and complex with juicy blood oranges, toffee, fresh tobacco and a lovely coastal touch. After its briny and spicy arrival, the taste develops with intense wood influence, bitter walnuts and a surprising flash of menthol. Astringent dryness and distant hints of spearmint remain of a weak and quickly gone finish, where chill-filtration has taken its toll. Not the greatest malt of the range, but worth a try.RATING: 3.4/5.0 stars ≙ 82 pts → ABOVE AVERAGE [-]

reviews.nose: Apple, plum, citrus, mint, pear, honey, malt and strawberry. A little sickly but not all that bad.
reviews.taste: The meatiness of exhausted sherry casks with some mint (perhaps even peppermint chewing gum) and pepper from the bourbon barrels. Quite bitter as well... almonds? Fortunately still someting fruity like strawberries and some smoke. Pretty sharp for its low ABV. Very hard to pinpoint this one, almost like a blend.
reviews.finish: Plum, mint, strawberries and smoke. Very dry in the long run.

reviews.content: Best pleasant whisky, nice balance between sweetness and pepperiness / character. Not too complex / full of flavor, but fine as 'daily dram'.
Mainly sweetish whisky with especially fruit in the fragrance. Supplemented with a slight pepperiness and in the distance a little salty and smoky.
reviews.nose: fruity and sweet. Apples, banana, orange peel, honey, vanilla. Slightly salty and smoky in the background.
reviews.taste: Slightly peppery. Sweet predominates, honey, toffee and vanilla. And some wood tones.
reviews.finish: Mid-length. Lightly peppery, vanilla and honey. Afterwards it becomes somewhat dry and bitter, with some cocoa-like influences

reviews.content: N: briny (like a real coastal highlander), grass, fudge, honey, beeswax and fruity - orangeT: beeswax, grass, spicy and some nutsF: dry and long, citrus, bitter and later pure raisins

[May, 2017]   Many years ago I had my last standard edition Oban so today's distillery visit is a good refresh on this.  I expect nothing spectacular and I get ... nothing spectacular.  Just an easy to drink dram with the claimed honey and oranges profile.  Warming entry on the palate but not much coating.  Both the taste and finish are very okayish, yet nothing to remember by tomorrow morning.  But hey, such a whisky is made for drinking and not for "analysis paralysis"...
very nice oak fragrance. It easily comes to the tongue, without any irritation. Very pleasant. Aromatic and round. Very good for the price ...

reviews.nose: Karamel, citrus fruit call in vanilla
reviews.taste: Oil, lots of citrus and vanilla
reviews.finish: What short but sweet with a small pepper

reviews.content: Nose:- Non aggressive, gentle waves of cola, malts and strong coastal note with touch of iron. Sea breeze with obvious kippery character. Whiff of raw vegetables and paper ashes. Palate:- Unlike the aroma, the true color reveal on palate. Thick and full body, wood-oil extract bitterness with light fruit essence fragrant. Pineapple with salt and thick chili soya. This is a salty and spicy chap. Finish:- Short-medium length, chili spicy, charred oak. Eye-watering. Control your breath, dont get choke. — at The Whisky Bar, Kuala Lumpur.
Nice tasty whisky with a fine spicy touch.
reviews.nose: Fruity and spicy, yellow fruit, citrus, slightly sweetish, salt and pepper, some oak, a hint of smoke, I am used to other calibres, malty
reviews.taste: oily, supple, sweet, fruity, slightly tart fruit, grapefruit, orange, some oak, vanilla, in the mouth more in the fruity direction, at the tip of the tongue clearly salt at the second sip
reviews.finish: in the aftermath then also the spice shown in the nose, salty, still long decaying oranges, slightly creamy, smoke even in the end to guess, from the neck then also some pepper comes up again

reviews.content: 2020 Rating

SeaIt had been quite a few years since I last tried the Oban 14 Year Old. Unwarranted neglect, I might add, for every time I try it, I quite like it.The nose has a malty heart with honey and citrus fruit, but also a nice smokiness and loads of pepper. I get some figs and something that reminds me of the sea. This is a nice and aromatic nose.It is quite full of flavor and pretty feisty. Loads of heather, pepper and some maritime elements.In the rather short finish, the saltiness returns, with some toffee.Admittedly, it is not the kind of grand malt that makes you lyrical, but still it delivers what you pay for. Thanks, Pat!

Peatier and spicier than I remembered it. Citric, floral, mineralic, peppery / gingery, salty, fresh. Almost like a deluxe, higher-aged, more spicy, all-malt version of Teacher‘s Blended Scotch. Certainly not a „smooth“ whisky, I wouldn’t recommend this to beginners or casual whisky drinkers because of the peppery heat. Speaking of: At 43 percent, you wouldn’t think so, but it actually gets better with a drop or two of water.
reviews.nose: Sour-sweet, gains in complexity and creaminess with a bit of water.
reviews.taste: More peppery and sharp than you‘d expect. White pepper, ginger, chili. Water balances it out. Salty, mustardy, acidic, and softly, but noticeably peaty.
reviews.finish: Quite oaky, actually, with spiky, zingy tannins and an ashy kind of peat that prolongs the experience. Still a lot of pepper as well.

reviews.content: Already drinkable, but very reserved, what he is known for.
reviews.nose: Fruits, berries, salt, hints of smoke, honey, aromatic but also a bit shallow
reviews.taste: Quite sweet and light, honey with herbs, with salt, light oak and cereals, very delicate, hints of pepper / nutmeg
reviews.finish: Medium long, almost more intense than before in the middle part, dry, malt, salt

reviews.content: Fine elegant whisky, a little orange, salt and a little peat. Sometimes comes really good, sometimes rather difficult.

reviews.nose: Smoky, fruity, sweet malt
reviews.taste: Sweet, fruity (pears), spicy, coffee
reviews.finish: Long, dry, soft, salty, coffee

reviews.content: a 14 years old tasted a long time ago, and who has not moved qq years later!
reviews.nose: Spices, wood, kernel, then sweet scent
reviews.taste: Spices, then caramel and candied orange, it piques a little, it's iodized
reviews.finish: short to medium, little to say if not a wild side (iodized, not smoked) that combines well with a candied fruit caramelized

reviews.nose: sea air, fog. Oranges, Grapefruit, Nuts. A touch of nougat. deciduous forest.
reviews.taste: Creamy. Apricots, chocolate, a hint of nutmeg. Some peach, walnut and a hint of salted caramel.

reviews.content: Nose: lots of alcohol in the nose, salty, spicy (some cardemom), vegetal and a little sulfury smoke.Taste: medium bodied with some sherry sweetness and bitter herbs.The finish is very one dimensional, I only get a very dry bitter woodsap.The nose is pretty ok but then it really runs downhill. This is actually one of the few whiskies where I'd wish the finish to be shorter. Oban 14 yo clearly does not rock my boat.
Very smooth and creamy whisky. Almost island caracter.
Makes a strong impression, the 43% Vol. Are well chosen. For my taste, the bitterness is a touch too dominant. In return, the excellent spice compensates with the thyme influence.
reviews.nose: Vanilla and vanilla cream, maritime sweetish and very ashy smoke, very many raisins, all in very dry fruit with figs, amarena cherries, caramel, cedar spice with hints of eucalyptus, some oak and spicy hazelnut, grapefruit and immature orange, apple and cinnamon, tobacco, blackberry and pear juice, banana, slightly malty, heather
reviews.taste: subtle smoke and ash, vanilla, rather sweet and honey-like, toffee, some oak and malt, spicy cedarwood and tobacco, strong mineral notes with thyme, slight bitterness of dried fruit, hay, salt effects
reviews.finish: Ashtray habit, dry and nutty, cedar, citrus (orange & grapefruit), chocolate bitterness, grass, aromas of prunes, some mild pepper, later vanilla and malt

reviews.content: This Oban was, along with the classics of Ayla (Lagavulin 16, Laf 10 and Ardbeg 10), among the first whisky I tried. Then he did not particularly like me, I remember an excessive amount of oak and one-dimensionality, but, apparently, over time, either got used to the oak, or developed receptors and now it seems to me a very good mole, but it does not shine with a variety of derivatives, but has its own individual character, sufficient complexity and depth, which puts him, IMHO, in a row of the best basic products.
reviews.nose: Open, calm, processed wood, raw wood dust, light notes of varnish and solvent, salty and mineral shades, leather goods, lemon zest.
reviews.taste: Thick, oak-lemon, varnish, oily, a little pepper, creamy sweet notes - toffee, boiled condensed milk.
reviews.finish: Soft, bitter-sweet, toffee, bitter bark, grapefruit and lemon peel, burnt crackers, nuts, lacquer notes, oily.

reviews.content: Body;firm,smooth slightly viscous.
reviews.nose: Like pebbles on the beach. A whiff of the sea, but also a touch of fresh peat, some maltiness.
reviews.taste: Deceptively delicate at first. Perfume.Faint hint of fruity seaweed.Then lightly waxy,becoming smoky. Dry.
reviews.finish: Aromatic,smooth,appetizing .

reviews.content: Nice, but relatively unspectacular whisky. Delicious drink, no more, no less.
reviews.nose: Iodine, honey, heather with some canned fruit cocktail juice.
reviews.taste: Slightly oily, balanced sweetness, a touch of honey mustard from afar. complacent
reviews.finish: Gone very quickly, quickly fill the glass again, then it works ;)

reviews.content: On the nose, the smoky peat gives way to lemon and a sweet smell of nuts. A little menthol touch, herbaceous fragrances, autumn breeze. Light fruits, not too ripe. Quinces, apricots. On the palate, returns of peat and honey. Vanilla. Peach pit. The whole remains velvety and slightly woody. The finish is very sweet and quite long. It gives on dried fruits. Spicy cereals in retro-olfaction. Barley, hops, wheat. It is fragile and gently balanced. It's velvet, as they often say. That said, it's not really to my taste, lacks character. https://ilikesky2020.blogspot.com/2020/06/oban-14-yo.html
The inspiring aroma crashed against the darkness and fatality of the plinth taste and a very terrible alcoholic aftertaste! 22 20 19 18
reviews.nose: Fruity and bright, full-bodied, peony petals, floral perfumes, vanilla, fresh oak plank tannins, slight mellowness and slight burnt wood phenolicity. Saturation: 8.5 out of 10
reviews.taste: Over oak whisky! Sweetish, fruity, very bitter due to the abundance of tannins barrels, plinth, vanilla, citruses, some phenols. Saturation: 7 out of 10 Sweetness: 6.5 out of 10
reviews.finish: Skirting, bitterness of alcoholism and oak tannins.

reviews.content: Solid standard for 43 €, just as a beginner, you can imagine a bottle as a slightly smoky alternative as well, it will not get boring quickly.
reviews.nose: fresh-fruity, apple, lemon, pear, slightly salty freshness, gentle, dry smoke ... after some time it becomes sweeter and fuller, dried fruit, gingerbread spice
reviews.taste: hard to grasp ... there is something creamy-sweet, caramel, covered by bitter notes, herbs, coffee ... pepper and some salt
reviews.finish: medium length, slightly bitter, some licorice, pepper and salt

reviews.nose: Honey, honeydew melon, apple, peach, apricot, slightly maritime, a bit of salt, a few grasses, a bit of old wood, you could also imagine a hint of smoke
reviews.taste: Apple, apple peel, apricot, peach, dried herbs, some grapefruit, salt, fresh wood

reviews.nose: Citrus fruit, apricots, cider, yeast dough
reviews.taste: Green apples, lime, lemon sorbet, orange peel, a bit of salt, or rather salty herbs, you can feel the alcohol towards the end.
reviews.finish: No revelations, it heats quite strongly

reviews.nose: Fresh ginger and cucumber.  Fruit gum.  Lemon peels and some vanilla bean.
reviews.taste: Medium bodied. Sweet and fruity.  Apricots and melon.  Spicy, with traces of oak.
reviews.finish: Medium.  Fresh and still fruity.  Malt creeps in at the end.

reviews.content: S 7Bottle from the early 90s. A bit disappointed by the nose, but it improves thereafter. Similar quality to modern 14 but a bit richer, I suspect the initial vats has higher ratio of older stock.
reviews.nose: Rose moisturiser. Vanilla. Honey drizzled barley. Red apple. White pear. Blood orange. Old wooden cupboard. A little dusty, but feeling old & dignified. Then fizzy lemonade and mildly prickling alcohol blows the cover. A whiff of hot copper. A pinch of rock salt.
reviews.taste: My warm and spiced honey drink, very quaffable. Sugary and oily mouthfeel. Ginger root, crushed peppercorn, cardamom. Manuka honey - intense like having a spoon of it straight. Toasted malt and mildly bitter oak. More juicy orchard fruits. A little metallic towards the finish.
reviews.finish: Medium, slowly drying finish. The honey malt continues. Red apples. Warm oak spices.

reviews.content: In my pre-historical scoring method, it's an 8.8/10.
reviews.nose: Rich honey. Pear. Coastal peat. Citrusy.
reviews.taste: Mildly oily. Honey and spices.
reviews.finish: Short-Mid, dry finish. Mildly oaky. Lightly smoked at the back

reviews.content: Not good, not bad - a malt without qualities.
It has its place in the classic malt range. Perhaps not optimal in terms of price-performance ratio, but a fair bottle.
reviews.nose: Smells like buttery cardboard. It's not a nose that impresses. But very pleasant with a little salt in the air. Malty.
reviews.taste: Malty and salty. Or rather a distillery on the coast? An oily respectable body.
reviews.finish: Clean and dry finish. What remains is the wonderful nature (flora) directly on the coast. Round and clean.

reviews.nose: Spicy. Hot sawdust, fresh ginger, citrus zest. Crisp. With water fragrant oak, allspice, shortbread with sugar. Summery.
reviews.taste: Dried apricot, tingling. Slightly sweet with good balance in the mid-palate. Hint of menthol.
reviews.finish: Tingling ginger. Short but fresh.

reviews.content: Nose: very fresh, light, pleasant! Vanilla, honey, beeswax, toffee, fresh green apples, pears, citrus, lemon peel, grapefruit, ginger, a hint of spice. Taste: Vanilla, toffee, hints of chocolate, pepper, ginger, citrus, honey, orchard fruit, ripe apples, pears, peaches, spices, wood tartness, herbs. Finish: Short and pleasant, vanilla, citrus, salty, very tart, nuts, wood, pepper, unfortunately at the very end it slightly "burns the pipe"

Nose: obstler, smoke ?, slightly musty, cherries, potatoes,, spices, oak, alcohol  Taste: strong onset, pepper, spices, oak, quite flat, less light fruit  Finish: spicy, medium long, vanilla at the end,
I like this understatement. surely not a great but a substantial and very honest bottle that I really enjoy now and again.improves with every sip.86/100
reviews.nose: a little shy at first nosing. slightly smoky and quite malty, coastal with sea breeze, sandy beach and wet pebbles. some apples and a little marzipan.
reviews.taste: the palate is much stronger. nicely balanced with malt and honey,pastry, smoke and light fruit (apples and lemons). nutmeg.good coastal touch.
reviews.finish: medium to long, still slightly smoky and quite malty. there´s also a little ginger in the aftertaste

reviews.content: Nice, funky whisky for me, I think this isn't for everyone...Nose is nice for me but other segments lacks behind
reviews.nose: rotten tomato, fresh tomato, fruit basket, basement, hints of costal notes, pretty funky
reviews.taste: nice mouthfeel, hints of smoke, but too spicy for my taste, alcohol is too pronounced for me
reviews.finish: spicy, dry, burning, light bitterness, IPA beer

reviews.content: Nice mix of fruit and sweetness with light spice. With the addition of water, the fruit notes appear clearly. A good single malt for all days - 15.02.2014
reviews.nose: Nice sweetness, ripe fruits, pear, banana, peach, caramel, malt
reviews.taste: Nice interplay between fruit and sweetness, slightly spicy, oak
reviews.finish: medium

reviews.content: So I actually find the nose really good. A beautiful fruitiness that looks almost exotic. Ripe citrus. Plus the mild smoke and oak. In the mouth, unfortunately, then quite boring. There is not much left of the fruit. The oak is already there and the smoke looks more dull.  The nose is quite good. In the mouth it is rather casual and not very exciting.  Not bad for a pub along with a beer. But it is not enough for more.
As a digestif after a meal, absolut wonderful. Wild herbs and vanilla with a subtle fragrance of a sea brize are merged together. Really pleasant and easy to drink. A forgotten "classic" bottling.

This whisky really grew on me. In the first months I wasn't that enthousiastic about its profile and I would give it around 80 points. Almost two years later I emptied the bottle, and it oxidated really well. It's indeed a maritime dram with some flavours you won't encounter that often in other malts.
reviews.nose: Wet dog, hay, and maybe a hint of mushrooms. Also more conventional notes like honey, citrus fruits, and vanilla. Quite coastal too (sea spay, mussels), black olives, and a hint of smoke. A bit shy at first, but opens up beautifully with a dash of water.
reviews.taste: Quite mineral with an oily texture. Whipped cream, mussels, fennel, lemon and some mustard.
reviews.finish: A bit weaker but still quite broad in flavours: Malt sugars, leather, oyster, black olives, aniseed, bitter oranges and apple.

reviews.content: The smells on the nose correspond to the taste. Let this whisky stand for about 15 minutes with a few drops of water, then the fruit notes will come up.
reviews.nose: Sea salt, little smoke, lemon and with water vanilla, apples, pear, pineapple and melon.
reviews.taste: Sea salt, smoke flavor, lemon, apples, pear, pineapple and melon
reviews.finish: Medium, dry citrus notes and tropical fruit.

reviews.content: Balance sheet (21)  Cute, the origin of shrimp is not clear but funny (84)
reviews.nose: Strange aroma of boiled shrimp????♂️ ... salt and fruit ... tree ... grass ... (21)
reviews.taste: The taste is fruity, slightly smoky, salty (21)
reviews.finish: Finish sweet, round ... smoke and woody spice (21)

reviews.content: A doctored whisky, needs to please everybody and thus doesn't please me. Heavy chill filtered and coloured. Although there is worse out there, I wouldn't buy it again.
reviews.nose: Sweet, vanilla, little wood, touch of fudge. Smells a bit doctored as this one needs to please everybody. It's not a bad smell, but hasn't got much depth.
reviews.taste: Soft as silk. Sweet, little sour. Quite some malt notes. Doesn't develop much. I assume every little bit of oilyness has been stripped with the chill filtering.
reviews.finish: Short-medium length. Some sweetness, wood and toffee. And it fades away as a whisper in the wind.
